I finally started refurbishing my paragliding website. Since I want to host it on the Internet as well as on zeronet, I am using one of the static generators from  https://www.staticgen.com/. I chose hugo as it seems to be fairly new and I could install it with apt-get. 
After some trial and error, I managed to get the URLs and links behaving. But the carousel doesn't load in zeronet. It works perfectly when using the hugo server.
The site is at: [paraeasy.bit](/paraeasy.bit)
Also, I have the impression it tries to fetch stuff from the Internet even though it is supposed to be static.

Fucking https://www.mollom.com/how-mollom-works spam filter censored me on my first attempt to participate in the following discussion: 
https://forums.tesla.com/forum/forums/payment-options-cryptocurrencies
My intended comment was long, but it didn't contain any of the things they say to block. I didn't even get a captcha.
Here is what I was trying to write:


Bitcoin is the future!
Privacy is only one feature, and it's often misunderstood. Bitcoin is only private if you are very careful about that aspect. 

But it has so many advantages over any existing means of payment:
* asset based
* cheap transaction fees
* no holding fees
* you can create as many accounts as you like to compartmentalize your holdings
* no requirement to bind an account to one person
* accounts can be shared between individuals or machines
* the car could have a bitcoin wallet and directly pay for electricity, parking, roads... maintenance
* can't be stolen as long as you hold it yourself and take care of your private keys
* no devaluation through (centrally planned) inflation
* In case of a dispute you can proof an unfalsifiable payment on the public immutable blochchain
* has escrow built into the protocol
* no chargebacks
* settles in seconds for low values and one hour for extremely high values.  

Yes it is more volatile than legacy currencies, but it gets better over time and generally trending upwards.
There are payment companies that handle the volatility and conversion to USD for you for a fee that is one fourth of credit card fees.

So, yes Tesla should look into Bitcoin. Better yesterday than tomorrow.

Oh fuck, the SSD of my server died last week. I should have created a backup image at the first sign of trouble. Instead I waited for the third time it remounted as readonly and I had to repair the filesystem, to order a replacement. I always complain that I would buy the movies and tv shows, if I just could. A plan such as netflix is not interesting to me. I want to pay for what I use, not a fixed rate per month, and then be locked into an ongoing contract that is hard to get out again.
So I launched another attempt at paying for content. 
Specifically, I didn't even know how I would go about watching Game of Thrones legally. I really wanted to do the right thing for season 7. A friend told me to go to the HBO website. So I did, and actually found the [episodes for season 7](https://hbo.co.uk/game-of-thrones/season-7)
The episodes list 7 different options to buy. 
* apple itunes: I have no apple device and no itunes. My browser reports: itmss is not a registered protocol.
* Amazon: The website asks me to activate DRM in the browser. No thanks! I don't buy stuff that has DRM! And I don't activate any binary blob in the browser!
* talktalktvstore: The website displays a banner, that you can browser the stuff, but I can't watch it.
* google play: I didn't use a google account in years. No idea what I would get if I reactivated my account. How I could pay, and where I could watch it. Specifically, I don't have an Android device.
* rakuten: We are deeply sorry but Rakuten tv is not available in your country.
* playstation store: I don't have a playstation, and the browser displays: Access Denied
* Xbox store: plays only on Windows, this implies DRM

Nothing working! What does that leave me with?

On the other hand, I love [reelhouse](https://www.reelhouse.org/) where I can pay for the DRM-free movies with Bitcoin. Just the selection is very limited.

Yesterday I upgraded my workstation to Ubuntu 17.10. It was the worst upgrade experience since I switched to ubuntu 10 years ago.
Initially I didn't like unity very much, but it worked good enough. Going back to Gnome didn't sound like a big deal to me. They always made sure the default environment worked very well in the past. But this time...
I was not able to log in after the first reboot. The bluetooth keyboard didn't work. My first thought was that I would have to re-pair under the new desktop environment. So I plugged in a crappy old keyboard to log in. After pairing the BT keyboard again, it worked .... for a few minutes. After some playing around I figured that it keeps working only if I use it constantly. As soon as I pause for more than two or three minutes, it's gone. And after the next reboot it is gone as well.
I find it hard to believe that I'm the only one using a bluetooth keyboard with Ubuntu.

@Icf20: So you'd prefer if the seller of your car could go to a corrupt policeman and tell him that he didn't sell it, but you stole it? I don't think giving control to a central entity to edit the history is the solution. One possible solution might be to register the property also on the blockchain. E.g. with a colored coin.

@Icf20: A judge can order the seizure of your income, but a judge can also be wrong. So it is good that there exists some property that nobody can take away from you. In general, people are better off in countries that respect their citizen's property rights. What is the point in saving, if you can't be sure if it's seized in the future?

@Icf20: If the employee and employer are within the jurisdiction of the court, the salary can be rerouted to some arbitrator even if it's BitCoins. There are lots of cases where robbers of diamonds or whatever hide the treasure somewhere to pick up after release from prison. Society generally accepts a certain level of criminal misbehavior, because living in a totalitarian dystopia where everybody snoops at their neighbor would be much worse. Bruce Schneier describes this delicate balance very well in his book "Liars & Outliers"

@Icf20: To say the colonists have a better claim on the land of the natives, is like saying the Nazis had a better claim on the Gold of the Jews. And that Erdogan has a better claim on the money of people who favor other politics.
